Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here. Read why:”
Reviews.Author: Luis Guilherme P
Reviews.Content: I was wondering whether I should give this hotel one or two circles. I gave it two, for it's localization and it's staff, specially the night staff. And good things stop there. There was no hot water most of the time, a dog has pissed on the elevator floor and it took a whole day for it to be cleaned, I was requested to change my rooms during my stay, having to stop my walk in the middle of the day to go back to hotel and pack my things, forgetting my chargers at the old room -- and it took a whole day for receiving them back --, the restaurant was not good (not bad either, though), sheets weren't changed, rubbish was not taken out of the room; a really unpleasant stay. Also beware of all hotels at Via Catone, 21, Via dei Gracchi 32, Via dei Gracchi 17, and with names such as "Luxury Rooms": they are all from the same owner, and might show the same low quality.

Reviews.Title: “A PLEASURE!!”
Reviews.Author: Eilona S
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was amazing; the clean and spacious room, the helpful and smiley staff, the good and welcoming atmosphere, the fresh breakfast, the relatively low price, the location (one minute away from the vatican, if not less)!! a-m-a-z-i-n-g! not a single thing went wrong.. thank you so much for contributing to an excellent stay in the most beautiful city in the world. WILL DEFINITELY STAY AGAIN!!! Greetings from Israel!!

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, but I would recomend staying elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Cambodiarocks
Reviews.Content: My initial thought was to give the hotel a 1 rating, but to be fair I booked it because it was very cheap and based on the price it is merely a disapointment, not a disaster. Also, this was my first stay in Rome so I don't have comparisons. That being said, it seems I got what I paid for... except when I didn't. I paid extra to not be "in a sepearate building" and yet I was in a building around the corner from the easy to miss "lobby." I arrived at the address I was given on my reservation and was simply confronted with a blank locked door of what appears to be an apartment building. After standing confused and ringing buttons, a neighbor led me to the lobby around the corner on a different street. If you do stay here look for the sign of the Rendezvous Restaurant as the check deck shares a store front with them. DO NOT use their transportation from the airport. At their offer, I requested a car (for a 49e fee) to meet me at the airport. No driver arrived at the airport and I had to arrange my own transport. I tried to call the hotel to see if one was on its way and there was no answer on several tries. Good news was I saved 24e by taking a shuttle. The reservation also said that wifi was available in all the rooms. This became wifi available in all the rooms with a charge. Once I paid the 5e charge, it turned out that wifi was not available in my room. Their solution was that I could use the wifi in the restaurant. I ordered a beer in the restaurant (a large draft) and was given a bill for 10e for the beer. I was not even given the 10% discount off of this ridiculous price promised on my check in paper. I went into the lobby to use the computer to avoid using a table/pressure to get 10e beers and was asked to leave the lobby because "it was a place of business" - eventhough there were no other customers in the lobby. The staff (if 1 person at a desk is a staff) was never of help. No 110 electricity converter was available and when I asked where I could buy one they said they had no idea. I asked about currency exchange and was told that they did not do it. I asked who did and they said "probably one of the banks in town." No specifics were available. I asked if they had English language channels on the TV and was told "I don't know just scroll around and see if you find one." Breakfast was included but pathetic, and managed by an angry man I assume was one of the owners. Each of my 2 days there I had to wait on coffee for up to 10 minutes along with many other patrons, including some who were very vocal in their anger and disappointment. Cosidering it was hosted in the back of their restaurant the bland quality and lack of selection was insane. The location was great for visiting the Vatican and fine for other sites if you don't mind an extensive walk. Also, the metro is only 5 min away and I found it easy to use. Basically, my recommendaton is to spend $20 more and get MUCH better accomodations. I plan on coming back to Rome soon, and I definitely will stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “It was Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Andrewm41193
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was Luruxy as the rooms name luruxy room and the price was average, the waiters were helpful because they spoke in english language so we can communicate.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you a looking for best location”
Reviews.Author: Karolina12345
Reviews.Content: Hotel has good location, but other things is not so good, when you pay as for 4 star hotel. First- we writte before our flight, that we want to have separate beds and view to the street and got one big bed and view to the the yard. The second- room was with some holes in the wall, not safety electrical socket - so it's very dangerous for children (you will see in photos). Third - poor breakfast (only muffins, corn flakes, jam and butter), so the is nothing to eat, no eggs, no sandwiches, no hot meal. The last - very rude girl on the bar - no help for tourist, maybe she thing, that she is pincess, but looks not so nice..

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location, but not luxurious...”
Reviews.Author: Travelingfr0mNY
Reviews.Content: The price for this hotel was right--as we were there for only one night--and the staff was very friendly and helpful. But be warned that the reception is across the street from the given address, which was around the corner from the building where the room was--rather confusing. The triple room was comfortable--a decent size with great beds--but was borderline shabby, with some water stains on the carpet. Also the bathroom grouting was in sore need of updating. It was fine but we would probably not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a getaway”
Reviews.Author: liam1234
Reviews.Content: I work very hard and was stressed out. I decided to go to Rome to get away from it all, and it was the BEST decision i've made in a long while. The location of the hotel is brilliant, as it is justa few minutes away from the Vatican on foot, and is also extremely close to many of Romes great attractions. For example, the Colosseum is only 20minutes away on foot. It is also close to the main shopping streets of Rome. Apart from the location, the hotel in general was fantastic. The staff was as friendly as can be, the rooms were nice and the food was delicious. All in allit was everything I was looking for. The perfect place for a getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brian1991
Reviews.Content: We came to Rome for our holidays and were pleasantly suprised by the hotel we had booked. The staff was very friendly and answered all our questions. The location is excellent as it is just a two minute walk away from the Vatican and very close to many of Romes attractions. All in all a brilliant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, steps from the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: P-tosh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights during Thanksgiving week during the second leg of our stay in Rome during a week-long Italy trip. The hotel has a very nice location, and is literally a 5 minute walk to the Vatican. It was a little difficult to find as the rooms seemed to be in various residential buildings around a block and the reception is across next to a cafe that also doubles up as a breakfast part of the B&B. But the staff was friendly and they found us while we were looking for the hotel. The room we stayed in was decent sized but it was in an old apartment building. The closet, for instance, did not have a handle to open and the seat on the WC was chipped. The shower stall was also small but that seems to be the case generally there. It was also more expensive than our previous hotel in the city, but I think the premium was due to its proximity to the Vatican. The breakfast at the restaurant was a little disappointing as the buffet was not replenished often and you had empty plates with a couple of pastries left and 2-3 people waiting to get food. There is also no free Internet. Still, our overall stay was comfortable and the location is terrific. We spent most of the time outside walking around Rome and the Vatican anyway. And it is close to a Metro stop that takes you right to the heart of the city in a few minutes. If you are not looking for too many frills and are looking for a budget hotel in a great location, this is definitely a place worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room/service, excellent staff... BEWARE of the old man”
Reviews.Author: BtchNMoan
Reviews.Content: My parents and I were on our first vacation to Rome. Our choice for the hotel was based on location and others' reviews on this website.  When we arrived at reception, we were led to our stay which was located a bit down the block from reception. We ordered the two-room suite for 5 nights for 3 people. The suite is immaculate, with a jacuzzi and a full kitchen, although the stove does not work or is not meant to work, it's still nice to have a kitchen. The staff was warm and helpful. Our only complaint is the troll-like old man who apparently is the owner's father and feels like the staff is not up to par on their duties, constantly ordering them around when they are busy with other duties and being rude and disrespectful in general. Perhaps that is old school Italian that I am not familiar with but why get pissy with guests who are spending quite a large sum of money staying at your hotel? However.... On our fourth day's stay, I wanted an extra cappuccino for me and my mother. We had one each. The old man started counting in Italian and looking very angry. I do not speak Italian but took Latin in school. There were two other guests around who did speak Italian and he started mocking me and my family in Italian to them with me standing there! One of the guests said that only two was included with the meal. I then inquired, ok well i only had one. He then put his hand to his cheek and made a gesture to suggest that we were thick-skinned and mentioned two words that I did understand. Familiae and Cinese. Family and Chinese.. Perhaps I looked young (im a Wall St professional and could have recommended colleagues to stay there on trips) and did not speak the language so he thought it okay to call me and my family names. If he wanted me to pay for the extra cappuccino, he could have just explained and told me how much it cost... It was an unnecessarily degrading experience. I still would recommend this hotel as the other staff was very accommodating, the rooms are of good value, and the location is prime... but I hope that the owner takes note that the hotel will lose lots of business because of the busy old man running around. One thing I noticed that was quite funny was that some napkins had inconsistent folds on them, meaning somebody (probably the cheap old man), took the un-used (hopefully) off the table guests left and put them back in the napkin pile! I actually had no problem with this as times are tough and napkins are napkins, they wipe, folded or not.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, cosy & well located, but poor shower!”
Reviews.Author: Paris12
Reviews.Content: My main criteria for booking this hotel was the location (3 blocks from a subway station and a short 5-minute walk to the Vatican) as well as the rate compared to similar class hotels around Rome. I paid €95 per night for three nights early September 2010. Hotel easy to find, swift check-in. The room was in a building about 100 yards from the reception in a nearby street. Although close to the Vatican, the immediate neighbourhood is really quiet. The room was a nice surprise, very clean, furnished in a 18th century style with elegant color schemes (dark blue rug, golden walls, brown furniture, old drawings, etc.). The bathroom was a big letdown though. The shower was tiny, with an extra long curtain closing half of the opening and a sliding door closing the other half. Nothing in the shower to hold soap or shampoo... and you can't bend since it's tiny. I let you imagine how awkward it was! Slight issues with the power plugs, very dingy and not all of them working. Breakfast was included in the rate and was very nice. Lots of different, warm pastries. Overall a great place to stay, I just hope they make an effort on the bathroom. I would definitely return there for my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Visited twice- Fabulous, NOW Disappointing!!”
Reviews.Author: acshunt
Reviews.Content: We visted Les Chambres d'or Hotel in 2004 and 2006 with friends and we had such a fabulous time the hotel was so friendly.On both occasions we were greeted by Sam who sat us down and made us cappacino's before showing us to our rooms. We went home and reccomended the hotel to friends who also visted in 2007 and had a great time. My Husband and I decided to return this year for our honeymoon as we knew that we were guaranteed to be looked after and have decent accomadation, However we couldn't be more wrong we were hugely disappointed! We had emailed 3 months prior to our visit explaining we were returning for and 3rd visit and this time for our honeymoon could we have a nice room. Our room was very small compared to rooms we had stayed in before, the bathroom was damp, the shower was broken (when asked to be fixed it was gaffa taped) wallpaper and paint was peeling off the walls however it had air conditioning which was very much needed. We had breakfast in the Rendevous cafe, the staff pretty much ignored us and we felt were quite rude, when on previous visits we had been seated offered coffee and pastries instead now we were pointed in the direction of luke warm coffee in a maker and dried bits of bread and pastries. This was all such a disappointment, however the location was perfect for us to escape into the romance of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Superb value !”
Reviews.Author: JonathanRowe
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms - a double & a quad. Chose this hotel as we only had one full day in Rome & it was a stone's throw from the Vatican - EXCELLENT location. We were in one block & my parents in another acrioss the street. Both rooms were very nicely furnished although they had a tiny shower. Breakfast was fine. This was a good choice but not the hotel for you if you like 5 star luxury & being waited on hand and foot !

Reviews.Title: “Comfy hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Michalfalcon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 1 night, while I was in Rome on city sightseeing. The hotel is located just a few minutes walk from Vatican and about 10 minutes walk from Ottaviano Tube station. It had a characteristic of a small family hotel. The reception and the restaurant were in the same room. The staff were very helpful and friendly. They spoke English very well. The room itself was located in the building across the street. It was small but nicely decorated with old fashioned furniture. In the room was Tv, phone and fridge with minibar. The bathroom was small with shower. The hotel had a wired internet connection. The breakfast was in Swedish buffet style, with great choice of bread, croissants, cheese, jam, fresh fruit and terrific cappuccino. I would definetely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: CanaryFairy
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked to stay somewhere else, but, the day before we travelled, I had an email to say the air conditioning had broken and we had to stay someone else. I stressed to start with as we had trawled through 1000's of hotels to choose the hotel we were originally going to stay in. I have no idea what that hotel would have been like, but the Les Chambres d'Or was lovely. The reception staff were very helpful, the room was small but very nicely decorated and clean. The bathroom, again, was small, but had a lovely shower and plenty of hot water. The rooms are across the road from reception and the restaurant, but that isn't a problem. The breakfast was lovely. Pastries, meats, fruit and yoghurts. Coffee and tea, juice available too. The hotel is central and not far from the Vatican area. There was air conditioning. The windows are double glazed and there was sometimes some noise from the street clearner in the early hours, but I think you would hear that whatever hotel you were staying in. July is very hot and perhaps not the best time to visit, but if you are ok with air conditioning (which I am not!) then you would have a good night's sleep. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice little hotel near Vatican”
Reviews.Author: UsaTrvlpro
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a nice find although not an easy one. The reception area is small and not marked very well. Our cab driver was convinced that it was closed and we were out of luck.. It is reasonably priced and in a decent area of the city. Our room was very comfortable and decorated very nicely. The air conditioning worked fine. The only downside that I saw was the very small size of the bathroom. If you dropped soap in the shower, you had to back out of the shower stall to pick it up. The desk staff was very friendly and helpful recommending a very good nearby restaurant .

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodations; good value and location”
Reviews.Author: JoseTucson
Reviews.Content: My 15 year old daughter and I stayed at Hotel Les Chambres D'Or for 17 nights as a "cheaper" alternative to a "typical" led-by-the-hand "tour." Quite frankly, there's nothing better than "living," "experiencing," and truly enjoying the sights, sounds, smells, and culture vs. a quick trip that rushes you through a checklist of places to visit, things to see, etc. Les Chambers D'Or was reasonable enough in price to allow us to stay for a long period of time in Rome -- time enough to get out-and-about, and even take a couple of days of just staying in and watching videos and relaxing. The hotel is very well situated at about a quarter mile from the Vatican on a nice relatively "quiet" street (for Rome, that is, since there wasn't that much traffic on the street itself). As many others have noted, the metro is about a five mintute walk from the hotel, and there are countless restaurants, cafes, and even gelatto places, near the hotel. What was truly helpful was that right next to the lobby is a small grocery store that sells 1L bottled water for 1 EU, which is the thing to do: buy a bunch of these bottles and use them to refill smaller bottles that you can carry with you (unless you prefer to spend 2-3 EU for a tiny bottle of water, or 3-5 EU for a can of soda, at a restaurant. The grocery store has cookies, fresh fruit, kleenex in case you get sick, etc...good cross-section of items. But back to the hotel: Accomodations: roomy with two twins that can be put together to turn into a queen; LCD TV with cable (no DVD or VCR); super-dark curtains/shades that will make you think it's midnight even at noon...outstanding windows that keep ALL the street noise out...wish high-end hotels in the USA had this configuration; telephone with free local calls...can't make toll-free calls (800) due to "restrictions and contractual arrangements" with the hotel's long-distance telephone service provider; high-speed internet throughout, and free....but confirm via email with hotel staff before you get there to avoid any possible "confusion" when you get there...nothing like having a printed copy of an email on hand in which they promise free wifi, just in case (I do this everywhere I travel, even in the USA, so nothing against the hotel); the room itself is "smallish" compared to customary USA standards, but not by much; the bathroom is a good size; others complain about the shower being small, but it shouldn't be a factor if you are "normal" size...if you are overweight/obese, well, you'll have a hard time fitting in anywhere, so please don't whine about "tiny showers"; housekeeping service is efficient and does a good job cleaning up...plenty of nice, clean, good-sized, towels; there is a small refrigerator built into the desk (we discovered it the day we left...haha); yes, there are non-contiguous "wings" to the hotel of various rooms, but they are separated behind a separate, private, keyed, hall door that is not accessible to the other building tenants; for those with any doubts: THE A/C WORKS PERFECTLY WELL AND IS EXTREMELY COLD, IF THAT'S HOW YOU WANT IT...we had to turn it up a bit at night, and had to use a blanket....so you can set whatever temperature makes you happy...if you can't figure out how to use the A./C, just ask the front desk and they will be glad to show you. Breakfast is OK, and free: includes coffee, tea, etc.; consists of boiled eggs, a couple of cereals; yoghurt; a couple of choices of fruit; LOTS of choices of rolls, sandwhiches, etc., with ham, cheese, fruit, and other fillings. No hot foods, but it's a VERY SOLID breakfast -- much more extensive than the typical "continental" breakfast. Location: My daughter and I walked 10-20 miles per day, on average; we only took the metro a couple of times...the only way to get to know the culture is to live it. If you don't want to walk, take the metro or get a more centrally located hotel on the other side of the river (I would recommend somewhere away from Trevi and Navona, but in the "general vicinity" of those locales...that's what I would do next time, simply to be a bit closer to "the sights"). I'll be happy to talk specifics with you in private, but the bottom-line is that the Hotel Les Chambers D'Or is a marvelous hotel, good location, great accomodations, "reasonable" price (vs other hotels), solid staff, and I would MOST CERTAINLY recommend it. PS Best things we saw: 1. Pallatine Hill (Forum is overrated); 2. Ostia Antica...do web search on getting there via metro...MUCH nicer than Pompeii, and closer, cheaper, less crowded, bigger, greener, less dusty, etc.... 3. Villa Bourghese, including the museum

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION - GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: NewZealandNeville
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel close to the Vatican and were not disappointed. The hotel is spread across three buildings with a separate reception (which was moved during our visit) and an adjacent cafe, owned by the hotel. Our room was across the street from Reception, with key access to the building, to the floor, and finally to the room. There was also video surviellance to the floor. The hotel Reception and cafe have been developed recently. Reception is now located beside the cafe. The cafe serves breakfast to guests, as well as catering all day to casuals who pass by. This is much better than earlier reports suggested for the previous arrangement. Our room was fine, slightly small but sufficient space to move around our four pieces of luggage. An iron and ironing board were provided in the room, unlike in Florence where they are forbidden in three star hotels. The bathroom was roomy, and the shower was excellent. However, note that the hotel is close to the Vatican, and hence is a long way from the Colisseum and Pantheon, plus the other attractions of Rome. If you are reasonably fit, the Colisseum is a good walk. The reception will book tours for you. We booked the Naples and Pompeii tour, but were not impressed by the tour organisation itself. The tour could have been much better organised, but that is the fault of the tour operator, not the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful what they promise!”
Reviews.Author: stevwilliamson
Reviews.Content: I wanted to go to Rome to celebrate my 10th wedding anniversary and after careful consideration I chose the Les Chambres Dor. I booked it three months prior to my stay and emaield them on two further occassions just to make sure that my booking was OK. Upon arrival I was told by the receptionist that I had been moved (without any reason) to another hotel about a kilometer away. No offer was made to assit with our luggage and we were given rough directions as to how to get to this "sister" hotel. I arrived at the new hotel to find the hygiene poor to say the least (bathroom appeared not to have been properly cleaned for some time and the shower was so small that I struggled to move when within it). I was also charged at the rates for the Chambres Dor even though I later found out that the hotel I had been moved to (Vattican Gardens boutique hotel) was cheaper (by 10 euros a night). I have since tried to speak with the manager of the Chambres Dor but they have ignored my emails. My message t o anyone who wants to stay at the Chambres Dor is don't be disappointed if you are moved and be carefull what they charge you when the decide that you should stay at another hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Safe, secure, friendly, clean hotel, very near the Vatican and St Peters”
Reviews.Author: misskf
Reviews.Content: As a solo lady traveller I can confirm that this hotel is safe and secure with friendly, attentive staff. True, the reception and breakfast room is across the road (a quiet side road) from the hotel, but there are security cameras and keys to the building, you go up the lift or climb the stairs, then a key to the hotel suite of rooms, then your own room key. The room had quite grand old fashioned furniture and furnishings, comfortable bed, safebox, small but fine bathroom. Considering its location the price was excellent. Breakfast was good, although you had to judge when to go to get a table inside sometimes. The area seemed safe too, wide range of shops and restaurants on main street 2 minutes away, near bus and metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! Nice, afordable, very polite and corteous staff”
Reviews.Author: marciopc
Reviews.Content: We could only notice 2 problems with this hotel, first is that it´s very hard to park anywhere in Rome, what to say right across the street from your hotel... second is that there are 2 numbers 32 on Via Dei Gracchi... these are all the problems you will find. The hotel is located at walking distance from the Vatican and subway. The rooms are clean, quiet and cozy, the staff is incredibly courteous, polite and kind (Samuel is the best!)... Great breakfest... Anyway we felt really welcomed and I would certainly recommend this hotel for anyone that is going to Rome and wants to be close to the action without spending too much.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected!”
Reviews.Author: JuneGledhill
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not at all what I expected. It is really just a group of rooms on different floors of an apartment block. It is fronted by a very small cafe which acts as reception and breakfast room ( max seats inside would be about 12). If is is raining or cold then ...standing room only. The first morning we were down about 9am and got the last seat inside. Others had to sit outside and it was still raining,but lightly. As I have a gluten free diet the young man who greeted us warmly promised all sorts for breakfast, but as he was not on duty for the rest of the stay, it did'nt happen. The only service we had was a coffee.. everything else was self service in a cramped area. The room was fine, but there was no air conditioning and we had to keep the window open in 28 degrees( lovely) in order to sleep. That was soon shattered by the club life opposite..Giorni... they came out to smoke, argue and shout at each other, quite an entertainment! It lasted until 3.30am. If you had a room on the courtyard side you would have been fine. We didn't let it spoil our holiday, but in no way did the hotel match up to its description as a boutique hotel. It was a new experience, but at least it was clean and comfortable, but I was expecting much more. There is no sitting room, no communal area for meeting people.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: PaigeUsa
Reviews.Content: Les Chambres d'Or was a good place to begin our trip through Italy. Sam was very helpful when we had an issue with a local ATM. The service was great. Room was small but clean and the beds were the most comfortable of our entire trip. A bit of a hassle getting to the hotel from the main train station but it is within walking distance of the Vatican so convenient for someone visiting there.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for seeing rome...unusual set-up, but it worked”
Reviews.Author: myra_jean
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a good hotel, and I would recommend it mostly to someone who wants to see the Vatican and avoid public transportation. I met a group of friends here in August and felt good about the experience by the time I left. Upon arrival I intended to take public transportation to the hotel, and was pleasantly surprised to see someone waiting for me at the airport with my name on a sign. I was driven in a nice clean van directly to the hotel, and then informed that I must pay 45 euros to the driver. Silly me, I figured that if they were going to show up without asking me that it must be included in the hotel. My friends had been warned about this, and made other transportation arrangements...but all said and done, it was probably a good thing since I got to the hotel so easily and safely while alone. The hotel has rooms spread across 3 different buildings...and since we didn't notify the staff in advance, my group was split up across a street. Calls between the rooms were free, so it wasn't really a problem. The room was very nice, with a huge bed and a tiny, but clean and updated bathroom. The AC was a bonus since it was so hot at the time. The breakfast at the hotel was perfect for us....mainly breads, cereals, yogurts, cheeses and meats...but the best part was that the hours went until about noon....so we could sleep in and still enjoy the breakfast, and we didn't even bother buying lunch. The prices around the hotel area are pretty steep, 8 euros per beer...but the hotel offered a much better rate since we were staying there. The staff was extremely helpful...they googled restaurants we wanted to go to, called them to make sure they were open, helped us find plug adapters for our Germany and US electronics and more. At the end of my trip, they even drove me to the train station since there was some confusion about arranging a shuttle ride. Wifi cost 10 euros for the entire stay. It worked in my room, and at the hotel lobby/breakfast area...but my friends had trouble picking up the signal in their room across the street. Junior was the most pleasant staff member, and Alessandro and Samuel were extremely helpful and warm people. They gave me a good impression of Rome hospitality. Between the 4 of us, we shared 2 rooms and paid 80 euros each (including breakfast). I booked directly through the website and communicated with Alessandro in advance via email.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cuculan
Reviews.Content: This is a great value hotel. It's actually in a 19th century Roman apartment block, so you get to use a cage lift. Very cool! Staff are very nice and helpful, very honest too. Sandro is a great manager, loves his job and does his very best to make your stay great. Deborah the tour guide is lovely and extremely knowledgeable about Rome and its history. It's 5 mins walk from Vatican museum in one direction, and the tube station in the other. Perfect! Small criticism- the rooms we saw have miniscule showers, if you are pregnant, in a wheelchair or even slightly overweight you would not be able to get in. They're so tiny that I kept turning off the water when I turned around. The mattresses are the type that seem popular in this type of Italian hotel- very soft, they get a bit squashed after a few nights. These are just small points. The layout, location and staff more than make up for them. You will have a wonderful experience of Rome in this hotel! I highly recommend the guided tour, well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: KiwichickAuckland
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in July and were thrilled with everything. The young staff are wonderful and could not be more helpful. The hotel is spotless and rooms are well decorated and appointed in a fabulous location 5 minutes from the Vatican and St Peters and metro stop. Sam could not have been more helpful when I e mailed to book and certainly did not rip us off as mentioned in a previous review. Everything was as stated and at euro 100 per night including a substantial breakfast and air conditioning was fantastic value for Rome. We were picked up as arranged at our lease car drop off which was in an industrial area of Rome near the airport. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff and when we return to Rome we will definitely stay here again. Thankyou to you all for making our stay so special.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: novicefam
Reviews.Content: We were at the hotel for three days -- June 27-30 -- and couldn't have been more pleased. When we arrived, Sam was there greet us. In fact, it appeared he was there waiting on us. The breakfasts were simple but just what we needed and everyone at the property made us feel special. I don't know if you could find a more convenient location to the Vatican, which was very important to us. All of Rome's other major sites were within walking distance or a 10-euro cab ride. I'd consider this a hidden gym in a city full of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great service.”
Reviews.Author: mmille10
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel. It was a great hotel with great service. We arrived early and we were invited to have breakfast while they prepared the room. The staff was very friendly and helpful and they all spoke English very well. On our last day we had to leave early and missed breakfast so they insisted on giving us breakfast items the night before so that we could eat in our room before we left. They set up our transportation to the airport which was great. The location is great and it is not noisy at night. The Metro station is very close so it is easy to get around and you can also walk to many of the sights. Overall we had a great stay and I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this Hotel, you will get ripped off by them”
Reviews.Author: TothDoc
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our stay and felt completely taken by this hotel. Sam, the proprieter, had noticed we had been double booked and never bothered to inform us until it was too late. He lied about commissions and fees associated with on-line bookings. He made us pay cash for our room and then charged our credit card for two nights for the double booking. He FAX'd us information for tour prices through the hotel and then when we got there, the price increased. To make matters worse, his staff told us that our ride to FCO would be cheaper if we found others to go with us. Guess what, he wasn't there when we left and the driver charged us the full amount. He had the opportunity to reply to an email I sent explaining our concerns and he never did. We have had to contact our credit card company to dispute the overcharge, what a fiasco. STAY AWAY from this rip-off!

Reviews.Title: “Spring visit to see my daughter”
Reviews.Author: canuck422
Reviews.Content: My daughter is studying in Rome so, a mid-semester visit was in order. Booked at Les Chambres d'Or Hotel after reading other Trip Advisor reviews. This is a fine, moderately priced, clean and conveniently located hotel. Room size was more than adequate and the staff was extraordinarily helpful, from assisting with planning out daily itineraries, provision of helpful maps and making reservations when needed at various museums. Continental breakfasts, included with the room, were more than sufficient. Highly recommend the hotel. RS, Rhode Island

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely divine”
Reviews.Author: MainerinLondon
Reviews.Content: The perfect location, superb staff, clean, comfortable rooms in a charming building. And the cappuccino at breakfast was worth the flight to Rome all by itself. I almost hesitate to recommend this hotel so highly--in case I can never get a reservation again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great staff, fab location!”
Reviews.Author: jubline
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome (following an argument with a taxi driver that tried to rip us off, I quoted the tourist police's telephone number to him and he soon backed down!) early in the morning. We went to the lovely coffee shop to check in. We were met with delicious coffee and biscuits. Our room wasn't ready, but they offered us a room at their sister hotel which we accepted as we wanted to dump our bags and get out exploring! We paid 90 euros per night for the room. The room was fantastic - huge! It was in view of the Vatican walls and we had a view of St Peter's basilica from the room. The staff were really great, nothing was too much trouble for them. The room itself was comfortable with everything that we could possibly need. There were local shops, bars and restaurants right outside and a taxi rank on the road outside. We walked everywhere. St Peter's Square is approx. 400m from the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a spacious room in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem - very very good value.”
Reviews.Author: Sh0nagon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 8 nights and was very happy with every aspect of the hotel. Location: It's easy to find and to get to from the airport (get the Da Vinci express to Termini and then the A line metro to Ottaviano and it's a 5 minute walk away). The Vatican is only a couple of minutes away so you can get there at the quieter times very easily. With the metro so close, it's very easy to get to all the sights in Rome. You are also a very short walk away from Via cola di rienzo which is the big shopping street in the area. The room: It wasn't huge but was perfectly clean and comfortable; ours looked out over the Via Dei Gracci so with the window open it could be a bit noisy, but you couldn't hear anything when it was shut. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was fine. The Staff: The manager, Samuel and the rest of the staff were always very helpful and friendly. The Breakfast: Was served in the cafe which doubles as reception and included excellent coffee, rolls, pastries, cereal, fruit and yoghurt. It was absolutely delicious and perfect for giving you the energy for a long day's sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Goldie004
Reviews.Content: Was our first trip to Rome. Which was not long enough. The staff are so friendly and helpful. Could not do enough for you. We will definetly return.

Reviews.Title: “Even better third time around!!”
Reviews.Author: vinity2
Reviews.Content: Our third stay at Chambres D'Or, and even better than before! We now love this hotel for four reasons: First, the rooms are VERY spacious by European standards. Our usual triple( with jacuzzi) was taken, so we got a quadruple room. We have been fortunate enough to stay at roughly 15 different hotels in Europe and Africa over the past several years, and this room is by far the largest. Second, location,location, location. Walk to the end of the block, and you see the wall of the Vatican. The nearby square, Piazza Risorgimento, has easy cab and bus access to the rest of the city. Third, and most important, the staff is SPECTACULAR!! We now feel like members of the family, and Sam, Vita, and Allessandro will always make sure you are on the right train or bus. Fourth, and newest, there is now Wi-fi in the rooms! I can write this review sitting at my window while still here. We love this hotel, and I wish everyone involved all success and happiness. Thanks for all your help! John, Robyn, and Michael Huffman

Reviews.Title: “Les Chambres D'Or - a jewel!”
Reviews.Author: Emerald_bud2
Reviews.Content: Date: September 24, 2008 Reviewer: Emerald_bud2 Montreal, Canada After a wonderful cruise of 11 days and a night in beautiful Venice, we were two couples looking forward to seeing Rome and what the last part of our journey would bring . We were very happy to get to the hotel from Termini Station – definitely requires a taxi – and we found a very nice cab driver and for 40 euros he brought us to our destination. The hotel is a little jewel set on a quiet street within walking distance (10 minutes) from the Vatican. The staff greeted us with smiles and offered us a cold beverage as we relaxed. Within minutes we were settling in our rooms located in a building adjacent to the office. The beds were comfortable, the rooms clean, spacious and had big (for European standards) bathrooms complete with walk in shower. Great breakfast of juice, pastries, sandwiches and coffee included. What more can you ask for? Would recommend Les Chambres D’or to all.

Reviews.Title: “A True Gem !!!”
Reviews.Author: sang67
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 night stay in Rome. What can I say about this hotel. The location was perfect for all the main attractions particularly The Vatican. The hotel was beautiful and the staff well ...... Sam and the others could not do enough for us They really looked after us well, nothing was a trouble and they made our stay extra special they are a real credit to the hotel. We will be recommending The Chambres D'Or to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “fell in love with rome and with the staff at les chambres d'or”
Reviews.Author: volvos40
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from our break in Rome, what can i say!Rome is just incredibily beautiful! the architecture the people, taxis, traffic!!! but enough about that. Lets get down to the real Rome. On our arrival we checked with the airport information kiosk as to the best means of transport to our hotel. We decided on a taxi and checked what the cost would be. Having been told a maximum fare to our destination which was five mins walk from St Peters square should cost no more than 45 euros we decided upon a taxi. To our dismay when we got to our hotel we were charged 60 euros, so watch the taxi! From the moment we arrived at Les Chambres D'Or we were welcomed by very friendly and accomodating staff. Sam and the guys made our stay in Rome unforgetable!!! Thanks from Francine and Jim . who were heading to Sorrento. sorry but we didnt get to Salerno, Sam, but Possitano was an absoloute picture postcard. Anyone reading this. do the Amalfi coast by scooter!! lose yourself, its an awesome trip, if you have the nerve!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Jim_X_MTY
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay in Rome from July 18th. to the 21st. 2008. We booked a Quadruple room for Me, My wife and 2 children 14 and 11. This hotel is Beautiful, near Vatican City, Vatican Museums and Metro, VERY convenient, they also booked us the Taxi from FCO to the hotel and back (45 Euros each). Hotel staff is very kind and helpful (Samuel even call me from Italy to my office in Mexico to let me know that my room and taxi bookings were ready). I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay in it again in the future. Breakfast is very good and there are nice restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: NorwichBartie
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this Hotel for three nights from 4th July 2008. We booked after reading reviews on TripAdvisor. We were visiting Rome with another couple and were allocated adjacent rooms. The other couple had a nice double room (no 10) but our room (no 9) was no more than a glorified single room with a double bed. There was hardly any room to swing a cat and only one small wardrobe. The bathroom was clean but tiny and the air conditioning barely functioned. We asked to be moved but were told this was not possible because the Hotel was fully booked. All we were offered as recompense was a free drink and when we asked for a reduction at the end of our stay the concierge became very hostile. It was a shame because the staff generally were very pleasant. Wouldn't stay again because overall for the price it was not good value.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: gmmcm
Reviews.Content: Beware. I read reviews on trip advisor prior to booking this hotel for 3 nights and we left after the first night. It took 3 keys to get in the room across the street from the lobby. We booked double and got two twin beds. Their solution was to push them together. The air conditioner didn't work. The internet was across the street in the lobby with a cord. The room was dirty, The shower had mold. The main light didn't work in the bathroom. There were holes in the sheets. The in room safe wasn't usable...etc. The only redeeming quality is that we were able to leave only paying for one night. I walked down the street to another hotel, was shown a room before booking and it's cheaper and much nicer with wifi and breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelBug
Reviews.Content: First of all, the hotel is a little hard to find in the pouring rain at midnight, but we got there.. The lobby was closed so we buzzed the manager and he came right away to show us to our rooms. He was very friendly and accomodating. He took all our bags through the rain while we walked behind him with the umbrella he gave us. We then went around a corner to another building with a sweet little courtyard. Our room was older looking but very beautiful. I was in love with the simplicity of this hotel. The bathroom would not be good for those who are too tall or "wide" as the shower was veryvery small. To bend over to pick up something meant both ends were touching something if you know what I mean... The hotel is a block away from Piazza Risorgimento. From there, you can take the bus anywhere in the city or walk right to the Vatican Museum or St Peter Square. I suggest getting a "Roma Pass" for 20 Euro. With this you have unlimited transportation within the city for 3 days, as well as 2 or 3 free admissions to the archaeological sites or museums as well as the ability to skip the lines. This was helpful at the coloseum. (the same entrance ticket which you get into the Forum so thats a bonus). From Piazza Del Popolo, you can walk to tons of other sites such as the Spanish Steps, Villa Borghese, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona, Pantheon, Castel St Angelo... I suggest taking a tour through the Vatican. That is not included in the Roma pass and you will definitely need to skip the line here. (Thats included when you sign up for a tour) The food was awesome at Riz Cafe in Risorgimento square (most of our meals were eaten here) But at the Chambres d'Or, they also have great food with a discount for those booked here. Also, if you ask, they can make things not on the menu. They are very accomodating and willing to please. VERY friendly staff. Loved this place, I would definitely return. The ONLY thing about the hotel was that it was too warm to shut the windows and they hasn't put in the a/c yet because it wasn't warm enough yet so we had to keep the windows open and since the buildings are so close together, there is a terrible echo through the streets and it's very loud at night time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: FnJ90
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Les Chambres d'Or for one night on a quick stop over in Rome. We chose it based on a friend's recommendation and because it is walking distance to the Vatican. The hotel was very nice and very secure. The rooms were very clean, nice sized and more than adequate for our needs. Although I don't recommend driving in Rome I did and the staff was very helpful in helping me find a safe place to park on the street in front of the hotel. It was easy to get to and from the hotel using my GPS. Breakfast was excellent and consisted of considerably more than just croissant and coffee. Two tips on finding the hotel is to approach from the west as that block of the street is one way west to east (I drove the wrong way down the street Neapolitan style) and the desk is actually across the street from the hotel entrance. Ring the bell at number 32 and they will pop across the street to help you. I recommend the place and will probably go back there on my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Place”
Reviews.Author: BQuigley
Reviews.Content: DANGER - DANGER - DNAGER Avoid this Hotel. First of all, the rooms are rooms they rent and are spread out at different locations. The first room they gave us was around the corner in a different building. I booked a room for three, my wife, my 26 year old son and myself. The room I booked was advertised as a room with a queen sized bed and a sofa bed. It had the queen sized bed but no sofa bed instead it had two twin beds in this tiny room where we were walking all over ourselves. The air conditioning did not work and because we arrived at 5:00 pm, they would not be able to have a technician there until the following morning. If you have been to Rome before in the summer, it is very warm there. Needless to say at the $300 per night rate, I told them that that was not acceptable and since they were booked fully, that they find me another hotel. They then moved us to another room across the hall which was equally cramped. (We noticed later that night, our original room had new occupants, presumably those individuals that were suppose to get our new room). When we checked in, they told me that the room was the best that they had. When they moved us, they again said that the new room was their best. They advertise Wi-Fi but it is not available due to "security reasons." So to be able to get Internet access, we had to go down to the small lobby. They then gave us a network cable to plug into their Internet access. After going through several cables and reboots every evening we tried, two out of the four nights we were there it worked. Their "technical support" was "We have access on our lobby computer, it must be your computer." I work for a software company and know how to make a computer work. I would never consider staying at this hotel again because of our experience. Also, although the Vatican is within walking distance, I would stay somewhere closer to the center of town where everything else is closer.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel (a must stay)”
Reviews.Author: paulmccann78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from Monday 26th May to Fri 30th May 2008, My Father, Brother and I stayed in this hotel. This is a wonderful hotel, and i would recommend it to anyone. from the moment we arrived we were made to feel right at home. The staff were absolutely first class, and interacted with us so easily, in particular Sam, Junior and the ladies man Resvan!!! We could not have asked to stay in a more friendly and homely hotel than the Hotel Chambres D'or and we will definately be back. I have already recommended it to quite a number of people, and they will be booking into this hotel also.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: jpe46
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Les Chambres d'Or Hotel in May and loved every minute. The hotel is ideally located near the Vatican, and close to the metro line and bus stop. The staff were so friendly and couldnt do enough for us. They all speak fluent English which is a great help. Sam was extremely helpful in giving directions to the various sights in the city. Breakfast was very good with plenty of variety. We had a large luxury room around the corner from the reception with an ensuite bathroom, mini bar and tv. On our departure the staff arranged our transport to the airport which was a great help. I would highly recommend a stay in Les Chambres d'Or and cant wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: thekew
Reviews.Content: Everybody was very helpful and they really made our stay special! After a horrible flight delay and an even worst airport experience, we arrived very late in the evening/morning and two of the nicest people were waiting up for us to make sure we got checked in and settled. They have an adorable little cafe where you have breakfast at no additional charge. The breakfast was excellent - a good selection of fresh fruit, pastries, cereals, yogurts, paninis, fresh juice and the most amazing cappuccinos!!! So if you want a relaxing morning after a long night this is the place for you. You could eat as much as you wanted and they were even okay with you taking some fresh fruit for your day out. The room was very clean, the decor was traditional, the only downside was the extremely small shower cubicle (not good if you are on the large side). We would definately use this hotel again because the staff was helpful, friendly and genuine - no pressure to tip but you feel like you want to in the end because they genuinely deserve it. The location is excellent -right next to the Vatican, near lots of shops and restaurants and ideal as a base in Rome! We considered our stay at this hotel one of the highlights of our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Roz08
Reviews.Content: 8 of us have just returned from a long weekend at this hotel and we all found this hotel just perfect and will definitely stay here again! The staff, especially the manager Sam, are very helpful and friendly (quite rare for a capital city) and the welcome drink was a nice touch. The rooms are a good size and extremely clean. The only slight downside are the small shower rooms with small shower cubicles - but this is more than compensated for by the friendly staff, cleanliness and location of the hotel. It is located in a lovely residential area, just 10 mins from the Vatican. There is a metro stop about 5 mins away so you can easily get around the city if you don't want to walk (we did a lot of walking as it's not too far from the main sites & you get to see so much when you are walking). We stumbled on a lovely Pizzeria, L' isola della Pizza on Via degli Scipioni, which is close to the hotel and would highly recommend it. It was full of locals which is always a good sign! We also had a great vegetarian meal at a restaurant near the Spanish Steps, www.ilmargutta.it. We had a great stay in Rome and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clair&Dave
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel situated a 5 minute walk from the Metro and a 5 minute walk from Vatican City. Drink on arrival along with map of the city was very helpful. The hotel reception and restaurant is across the road from the hotel which is in a block of flats. The hotel owns one of the floors. Very spacious room and bathroom. We were facing on the street so had loads of sunlight whch was lovely. Breakfast buffet amazing - so much choice of breads, meat, fruit, crossaints, juice. The most amazing espressos ever!!!!!!! A really good find and there is no way you could fault it for its price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi2006
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a brilliant location, a couple of streets from the Vatican, and was the perfect base for three days in Rome. We walked absolutely everywhere and found the hotel was close enough to everything for us. If you can't be bothered walking it is also close to a Metro stop and the Metro is very easy to use. The staff are really friendly and helpful, actually quite charming, and did everything they could to make our stay a good one. The room is not big, which seems to be typical of Europe, however it was very nicely furnished, comfortable and serviced really well every day. I would certainly return if I am back in Rome, and also recommend this hotel to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “stay away, We had to leave befor the stay actually began.”
Reviews.Author: fire9883
Reviews.Content: my wife and I knew there was going to be problems from the time we walked up to the address that is stated, the door locked with the hotel sign right there. After ringing the bell the recepionist ran across the street from a cafe and told us the check in was there. We were brought to our room which was around the corner. We walked through a building that had a odor of sewer. After being brought to the room which has extremely gaudy decor there were a large quantity of flys in the room ( because the windows were open, per staff) once we were in the room there was an awful smell of pesticides(?) in the room. We both got headaches from it right away. It was so bad that we asked for a room change. We had plans so we left before the next room was available. When we returned the room that we were given was half the size had the same smell but not as strong. the bathroom was the size of a phone booth. If you have anysize to you you will not fit into the shower. the opening is less than a foot wide. the toilet seat was cracked and if you washed your hands the faucet was one that belonged on a bidet (poor speller). The manager or clerk was an arrogent and a jerk (I'm being extremely nice) he asked us to leave because we were actually expecting what we were paying for. Don't stay here!!!!!!!! If you think that i'm just bitter about a bad experience read my other reviews. Cosmo dimedici Florence, hotel ociania, Rome , hotel tivoli emeraude etoil, paris france.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem!”
Reviews.Author: KSH&PSH
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were moved to this hotel after our original hotel couldn't take us due to water problems or something. I have to say I was initially disappointed as I had spent a long time, using Tripadvisor, researching and deciding on a hotel to find that all of that counted for nothing! But as soon as we arrived at the hotel we were given such a warm welcome from everyone! Sam was very helpful as were the waiters etc and they really made our stay special! The set up is a bit strange with rooms in 3 different buildings, all close together and the reception is also a cafe where you have breakfast, but it doesn't matter The breakfast was excellent - a good selection of fresh fruit, pastries, cereals, yoghurts and paninis with the added bonus of no time limit!!! So if you want a lazy morning after a few too many glasses of wine you don't need to worry about rushing down to breakfast before it finishes because it's always there! You could eat as much as you could fit in and they were even okay with you taking some fresh fruit for your day out. The decor is traditional, with an extremely small shower cubicle (this was the only downside - so if you're on the large side not sure it's the hotel for you!) but all kept clean and made a comfortable stay. I would definately use this hotel again because the staff were helpful, friendly and genuine - no pressure to tip but you feel like you want to in the end because they genuinely deserve it. The location is excellent -right next to the Vatican, near lots of shops and restaurants and ideal as a base in Rome! I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Bryen
Reviews.Content: We stayed just after Easter. Sam who runs the hotel and all the staff are very friendly and helpful. Our three person room in building opposite was clean and quite large. Breakfast was good. Anything we asked for was fixed and no trouble. Good local restaurants. Short walk to Vatican, 15 minutes to edge of city of Rome, 2 minutes to metro (clean and safe even at night) and only 1 euro to reach Colloseum in less than 20 minutes. Can't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: minibuslady
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week's holiday in Rome staying in Hotel Les Chambres d'Or. This hotel is so well situated , being literally around the corner from the Vatican, Metro, Open top Bus & good shopping streets which is a great bonus when on holiday. We had a most beautiful bedroom situated on the 4th floor of the building across the road. It was a pleasure to go through a courtyard with orange trees on our way to our room. We did all the usual trips, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps etc. We went to St. Peter's Square on Easter Sunday for the Mass celebrated by the Pope & also his Easter blessing . This was the nicest city break we ever had and, of course a hotel is only as good as the staff and, they made our stay so enjoyable and memorable, we had such good times with them wining and dining and having such a laugh. So, on behalf of Gerry and myself I would like to thank Sam, Vita, Rezvan, Alessandro and Junior for their friendliness and courtesy at all times. When I tossed my coin into the Trevi Fountain I made a promise to myself to return soon as we didn't get to see half of this most beautiful city and countryside and lovely people and, of course will stay again in Les Chambres d'Or. Accommodation was lovely and towels were changed every day. Overall, we were very impressed with all aspects of this hotel and would highly recommend it to travellers to Rome. Ann Fehily

Reviews.Title: “service was outstanding”
Reviews.Author: belaf6096
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Roma and stayed at Les chambres d'Or Hotel. As others have noted there is only the name "Hotel" when you walk down Via Del Gracchi. Samuel, who should be working at a 5 star hotel, greeted us and offered a welcome drink, when you came into the bar/breakfast area. He and the staff were the most efficient, helpful, and friendly group in all of Italy! Please note that this hotel is divided in a few different buildings. We stayed 1 night in a very small twin room but when we saw the difference in size with the room next door we asked for a larger room and was graciously moved into a much larger superior room overlooking the street. The hotel was very clean and it is a constant work in progress. While we were there the staff strived to make improvements on a daily basis. There is a high tech security system which was a plus. It ls also located within 10 minutes walk to the Vatican. The breakfast consisted of the best cappucino that we had in all of Italy, croissants, pastry, A couple of suggestions was to add kleenex and pens/writing paper in the rooms. Please note that you keep your room key and you have to go through various doors/locks to reach your room. The only issue we and others had a very difficult time was trying to open the door on the 4th floor. There were several locks and if you did not turn the key a certain way it would not open. We had to call the desk at 10:30 pm to have someone help open the door. Besides that the beds were very comfortable. Also, we want to thank the staff because of the morning of our departure, one of our passports was missing (we think it was stolen on the last day of our departure while shopping), we went back to the hotel and they helped us search our old room and called the American Embassay, arranged transportation, and worked out a deal for us with the taxi driver so we could try and still make our flight. I wish we could say we made it out that day but we were delayed at the Embassy because of a computer crash and they could not get the new passport issued in a timely manner, but the staff gave 120% to us that morning and we really appreciate their efforts.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value, superb service!”
Reviews.Author: GARYNorthampton
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, close to Vatican City and just around the corner from a main square offering a bus service of only 1 Euro to all the major tourist attractions. The service from staff was superb, they were so helpful in every respect. We also used their shuttle service to and from the airport which was reliable and reasonable. Breakfasts were amazing, a huge selection to choose from, unlike other hotels, and no limit to how much you could eat. The only downside we found to this hotel was the temperamental shower in our en-suite. Hot water was very inconsistent, although we found when we switched on the heating switch outside the bathroom it improved slightly, and the shower door was not fixed properly. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone on a budget - only 100 Euros per night for a family room plus a great breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: carlowguy
Reviews.Content: what can I say , from the moment we arrived to the moment we left the staff where fantastic, Sam sat us down and Val made us fantastic coffee's, whilst Sam showed us on a map the spots to see in Rome. the location of the hotel is excellent, especially with the metro and Vatican so close. we got the smallest room in the hotel but Sam offered to change it, which we declined, we were happy with what we had. the breakfast selection was fantastic as where our evening drinks with Sam and Co up the road. many thanks to all the staff and I definitely recommend this hotel if even just for the friendliness.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great staff, great experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: fencing4food
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the morning and Samuel greeted us with drinks and espresso. Since it was so early we left our luggage with him and visited the Vatican. Once we got to our room we were surprised about its location and cleanliness. Our room was located on the 4th floor of a residential buliding and it even had a courtyard. We have been to Rome many imes and we have stayed in many properties, including religious houses, but this has been by far our best experience. The buffet breakfast was wholesome and very nutritious and we never felt rushed or unwelcomed. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Best Spot in Rome”
Reviews.Author: orhighwater
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel at the Ti in the Rome Airport and was really nervous about it. It turned out we spent the last night of our trip in the best hotel. The very kind staff greeted us at the restaurant with wine and olives on the house, escorted us to our room in their hotel across the street where we found all the comforts of home, a nice bed thick walls. The view was just of the street, but we could hear the bells from the Vatican, just around the corner. It was a wonderful stay, terrific breakfast great restaurant and lovely room. I loved the fresh poured cappuccino - among the best I had in Italy, selection of pastries and juices. If I ever go back to Rome, I wouldn't stay anywhere else. They even have cable! A word of warning: the lift, hallways and lobby looked a bit out of date and we were worried, too when we walked in. Don't fear, the room was nice and clean and shiny.

Reviews.Title: “grazie Samuel, Junior!!!”
Reviews.Author: KayandKarina
Reviews.Content: The staff of this hotel deserves top marks. They are friendly, helpful and speak good english. It is no exaggeration to say they give the best service of any hotel you have stayed in & will ever stay in. Samuel & Junior are unrivalled in their warmth & hospitality. The lobby of the hotel doubles as a cafe. The food they serve is good and quite cheap since hotel guests get a discount. The room we stayed in was quite spacious although the bathroom was somewhat cramped. The hotel itself is within walking distance of the Vatican, and is situated in a cheap to mid-budget shopping area. The street next to the hotel is quite & peaceful. My wife & I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Spot to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Blueysmrs
Reviews.Content: What a great find in Rome. We arrived at the Hotel (yes, it is a little tricky to spot but we had arranged transfers so our driver figured it out) & were welcomed warmly. There was 8 of us - 4 adults 2 three yr olds & 2 six yr olds - and our bags were whisked up to our rooms as were we. They were more worried about getting the kids to the rooms than the check-in paperwork! In fact we only checked in after we had settled in to our rooms. And what great rooms. We were lucky enough to get the best rooms (2 quad rooms) and they were huge - you could have slept twice as many in there - and very clean, air-conditioned, comfortable beds, decent TV, quiet and most importantly, a spotless bathroom (toilet, basin & shower with the hugest shower head Iwe have ever seen). The shower hot water was iffy but we found if you turned on the hot tap first it seemed to work better. We had friends staying in a triple room & they were a bit squishy - 11 of us could stand comfortably but there wasn't much more room but the room was also extremely clean. Surrounding area was good - plenty of eateries & shopping and a short walk to the Vatican. Also about 2 blocks away is a metro station which made all the other sites a lot 'closer'. Breakfast was great - especially the custard filled pastries .........and the cappucino was yum! There was also a selection of breads, yoghurt, cereal, meats, fruit and possibly other stuff (we were too busy gorging on the yummy custard filled pastries!!). It's a real family feeling when you stay here & we were well looked after. What a fantastic start to our holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Great cappuccino, lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Wisaf
Reviews.Content: Next time we visit Rome, we will certainly stay in this hotel again. Nice and helpfull staff and they speak very good English. Quiet, save and good neighbourhood very close to the Vatican and the metro station Ottaviano is just around the corner. Plenty of restaurants and shops in the neighbourhood. The hotelrooms are in appartment buildings acrosss the road. You live between the Italians. Excellent breakfast, not Italian like at all. And last but not least, the serve a great cappuccino.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Staff”
Reviews.Author: Charmaine56
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very well located and clean. The staff was marvelous. Very helpful, accomodating and fun. Sam, Resvun and Junior were wonderful. They made our trip to Rome memorable. I would recommend this hotel to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked”
Reviews.Author: RunnerHouston
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel back in June and had received a confirmation directly from the hotel. However, upon arriving, they informed us that they had overbooked and that they would put us up in a better hotel. After making us walk several blocks with our luggage, we arrived at that better hotel which turned out to be the 2 star Adriatic Hotel. This place was a dump! We were so disappointed that the Hotel Les Chambres d'Or would do this to one of it's customers. Beware!!

Reviews.Title: “Almost the Pope's neighbour”
Reviews.Author: Mattsmum
Reviews.Content: As previous reviewers have commented, this hotel is different from most. Check in is at a low key hotel reception which is also a bar/pizzeria. The young lady who checked us in was really friendly, as was the young gentleman who escorted us across the road and round the corner to our room inside an apartment block. Stepping back in time, into the old style lift in centre of the building we wondered what we were going to find once we got to our room. It was actually really nice. Not overly plush but an excellent size with bathroom/shower, mini bar and large flat screen tv. It was very clean and linen fresh. We were given a welcome drink and map and told profusely to let them know if we needed anything at all. The location of the hotel is ideal for the Vatican and St Peter's. Literally 5 minutes walk. The Metro station is about 5 minutes walk away and there is a taxi station around the corner. The taxi fare from Ciampino airport is a fixed rate of 30 Euro (beware at the airport - the first driver quoted us 55 Euro even though the rate is fixed to central Rome). The taxi ride is definitely an experience - obviously no road rules are in force :-) Likewise with crossing the roads! There are numerous restaurants/pizzerias around the hotel. Shopping is on the same road as the Metro station. All attractions apart from the Vatican, St Peter's and Castille St Angelo are across the river. Walkable distances but can be tiring in the heat. Be aware that the Vatican is closed on Saturday afternoons and Sundays. Queues are smaller in the afternoon than in the morning we found. This hotel is in an excellent position, offers excellent value and has excellent staff. Would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The warmest welcome ever...”
Reviews.Author: Pablo-50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chambres d'Or for three days at the end of August. The hotel is as charming as the manager Samuel and his staff, who made every effort to make our stay as easy as possible without intruding. From the moment we arrived we were welcomed and treated like long-lost members of the family. The hotel is not like any other we have experienced. It's not ultra-modern, more homely in a Roman style. Your room may be in a block across the road or even (like ours) around the corner. Nevertheless the accomodation is very secure. Our room had all the essentials, wardrobe, beds, fridge, tv and a bathroom with a shower - which could be a challenge for larger person!! Breakfast is taken at the hotel reception inside and outside at tables along the pavement. It's buffet style with the usual continental selections of juices, cereals, yoghurts, fruits, breads, toast, jams, pastries, croissants - plus you can make yourself a hot (meat/cheese) sandwich or mini-pizza if you want. Supplies of coffees or cappuccinos will be brought for you. And evening meals can be cooked for you - limited to salads, pasta and pizzas of course. We found this option to be the best after a day's sightseeing. They are just as good, if not better than the offerings in the tourist spots - but much more reasonably priced. And you feel less like a tourist and more like you belong... This is a value for money hotel located incredibly within 5-10mins walk of St Peters Sq. - but if you are looking for a hotel with disinterested impersonal service then this is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared for the unexpected”
Reviews.Author: GarryTheEagle
Reviews.Content: Please be prepared for the unexpected when you arrive at Les Chambres D’Or. The place you will check-in appears to be no more than a small bar off a quiet street near the Vatican over which a sign states ‘Hotel’… but there is no hotel name on the sign. After checking-in you be taken across the street and around the corner into what appears to be (and actually is) a private apartment block. You will take the scary old-style steel elevator and at the appointed floor enter into what looks like one of the apartments but is revealed to be the hotel corridor off which lie the individual rooms. I write this to prepare you from the ‘what is going on, where is this guy taking me’ etc. experience that we (and I’m sure everyone else) finds. The rooms themselves are fine. They are very clean, and without the traditional Roman drains smell. The linen is of good quality, the bed we had was firm but very comfortable; I slept like a log. However the rooms are small. I would say overall about 3.5 stars UK. The plus side of this arrangement is that you exit straight on to the street (the apartments are very secure and have their own concierge) and not through a hotel reception. You don’t feel you are in a hotel. The location is excellent for the Vatican – literally a five-minute walk. For the rest of Rome that means a good half hour walk to the Coliseum, forty-five minutes to Spanish Steps etc., which after a couple of days we found wearisome. Taxis are cheap and recommended. Six Euros will get you back to the hotel late at night from anywhere central. Overall I would say the hotel deserves its high Tripadvisor rating and would without hesitation recommend this hotel on location if you are spending most of your time in the Vatican/St Peter’s area. If you’re wanting an easy walk to the Pantheon, Coliseum etc, then you might want the check around first. The hotel does represent excellent value for money; I would be surprised if you were to find a better quality room at their price within 4k of central Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good service makes all the difference”
Reviews.Author: R0sh
Reviews.Content: The service is the best advantage of this hotel. Nice, young, friendly staff volunteered all the local information on transport, tourist places, etc. They gave us a free map and pencilled in the bust route for the attractions we wanted to see. They also offered to arrange a taxi to take us to the airport (Ciampino), but unfortunately we had already bought return bus tickets to the train station. They said the taxi would have cost 45 euros (we were 4 people), I think it's 30 euros for 1 person and from then a supplemment for each additional person. Location is excellent, it really is about 300 yd from the Vatican and Metro station. Also, free complimentary drink on arrival (including alcohol) was very welcomed on the hot summer afternoon I arrived on. Breakfast and food in general OK to fill you up until the afternoon, but that is it. Breakfast was cold buffet with cereals, croissants, snadwiches and bagels filled with cheese, ham, tuna etc. There were also fruit, yoghurts and desserts. No hot food. Capuccino was great though, as it is in most places you buy one in Rome. We had a quadruple room and it was OK, but nothing extraordinary. I quite liked the flat 32" LCD TV in the room, maybe because it's the same one I have at home. Several national and international TV channels were available I have stayed in central Rome before and I think it is generally difficult to find a nice, comfortable place to stay (I'm not talking about luxury) in a reasonable area (for example the area around the train station looks a bit dodgy), so provided popularity doesn't make them drop the standard of their service I would definitely reccommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great food & the best staff.”
Reviews.Author: Neesybella
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an absolute gem! The staff were extremely helpful and so friendly, and nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were immaculate, comfy beds and the breakfast at the cafe was sensational. Location is great for all Rome tourist activities. Can't wait to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value In Rome”
Reviews.Author: fmrsgnl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Rome on June 13, 2007. Our party of six stayed in three rooms for four nights. Outstanding service! Great location for seeing the Vatican and for the other major Rome attractions. Great breakfast serving "white American coffee" with unlimited refills!!

Reviews.Title: “A Roman Gem”
Reviews.Author: QuebecEdward
Reviews.Content: This gem of a hotel was our home for a week. Its major strength is the staff. Freindly, helpful and ever accomodating, they give five star service all the time. We cannot emphasize this enough. We have never been better served. It is not surprising that we met repeat customers. Our room was clean, quiet (with windows closed and the a/c on) of standard European size. The bathroom boasted very pleasant ameneties and a good shower. The hotel is secure with controlled access and a room safe. A very generous continental buffet breakfast was served in a pleasant sidewalk cafe with a bottomless cup of cappucino or filter coffee. If you are looking for eggs and such stay home...this is Italy. Since the hotel is in fact a series of converted apartments you get an ambiance of neighbourhood living.
