The location is excellent for the Vatican and very good local shopping and restaurants are readily available. We recommend the organized private car to and from the airport. It is worth the extra to avoid hassle and angst.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: mojovirginia
Reviews.Content: Our rather large family of 13 went to Rome for a relative's wedding and stayed here. We couldn't have been more delighted. The staff was superb and extremely accommodating, especially considering our huge group. They booked all our rooms on the same floor as we had requested and went out of their way to be helpful, whether it was recommending a place to dine or providing inside tips to visiting the Vatican. Breakfast was delicious and the capuccino is to die for. Breakfast also includes fresh squeezed orange juice, and if you ask, they'll even make the red orange juice for you. Mmmmm! Our only regret about this place was leaving it to go to an awful hotel in Florence (Hotel River). We 100% recommend staying here and would, without a doubt, stay here again if we're ever in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: italyresident
Reviews.Content: This place is a little odd, but very charming. For one thing, the desk is in the bar across the street (which is also the breakfast room) and the rooms are clustered in part of two large apartment buildings. The rooms are small, but well appointed and very quiet. The breakfast is great. The best thing here is the staff--friendly, anxious to please and helpful. The next best thing is the location--easy walking to the Vatican and to a Metro stop in a nice area of Rome. Plenty of shopping and places to eat at all price ranges.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Les Chambres D'or”
Reviews.Author: jbrett1
Reviews.Content: My sister and I decided to go to Rome on the spur of the moment. Since we were going during high season, I had a dificult time finding the a hotel. I finally found Les Chambres D'or. I was hesitant because of the reviews I read about pictures being deceiving but I took a chance. It was the best move I made. The hotel is very close to the Vatican. I called a couple of days ahead to confirm our reservations and spoke to Sam. He offered us a ride from the airport. It was 45euros. A little expensive but worth the time it saved. I think we would have had difficulty finding the hotel also. It is in an apartment building on the third floor. Reception is across the street in a restaurant. Breakfast is also served there. The room was spacious, clean and modern - looks like it was just renovated. The bathroom was the same. Breakfast was simple but fresh: meat, cheese, bread, pastries, fruit and the best cappucino. You should get there early - it doesn't seem to get replenished too often. A 10% discount was offered if you paid in cash. I would definately stay there again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: seetherxo
Reviews.Content: My college age daughter and I just returned from a 6 night trip in Rome. We are from Michigan and stayed at Les Chambre d'Or hotel. The accomodations were great! It was very clean, and the owners were very friendly and helpful. It was a super easy walk to the Vatican and to the Metro. The breakfast was delicious and the coffee even better. I highly recommend this hotel. It was a perfect stay and helped make this mother-daughter trip to Italy a most memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Pámané
Reviews.Content: This is not a real hotel, it is a converted apartment, administered from a cafe across the street (Café Rendez-Vous) where the buffet-breakfast is served. It have a excellent location (less than 5 minutes walking to St Peter's square/ Sistine Chapel etc ) and also less than 5 minutes to the underground (Ottaviano). We’ve stayed in a family room (2+2) that was really great and clean with conditional air, the bathroom are good but the shower are very very tiny. All the staff is great, but Samuel is spectacular. If don’t bothers you the fact of not have a reception open all night, it will be a excellent (inexpensive) choice, and for me, definitively, it will be my hotel in Roma. A tip for the queue to Vatican Museum – use the lunch time (12, 12.30 is the time of the smaller line)

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great service”
Reviews.Author: Roamallover
Reviews.Content: A small hotel only 200m from the Vatican. Clean and comfortable room with generous size bathroom, with all amenities except tea/coffee making, although the owners provided a pot of hot water so we could make our own. Rooms are located on the third floor of a secure apartment building across the road from reception and restaurant where breakfast is provided. Restaurant is also open till 8pm and the meals are excellent and reasonably priced. Management were very friendly and obliging and we would recommend this hotel to anyone having a short stay to see the sights of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my wife and parents to Rome, and we loved staying at the Les Chambres D'Or Hotel. After a horrible mess-up with booking our rooms on Hotel Club (which meant that we actually did not have a reservation), the friendly staff put us up for the night, and then found us other accomodations for the next night!! Wonderfully friendly staff, beautiful rooms. The showers are tiny, like most showers in Europe, and you can barely turn around. It is located wonderfully close to the Vatican and to the Ottavianno subway stop (which closed every evening at 9pm for construction, but worked out okay). They provided a delicious breakfast for us across the street in a little cafe. I think it was a little over-priced, but overall we were VERY pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Crmmj
Reviews.Content: I gave a rating of five, but do not expect the room accamodatioms to be what Americans usually regard as primo. The room was nice, clean, and charming. But, the location!! The service!! The helpfullness of the staff!! These all exceeded expectations. This location is close to the Basilica,close to the Metro, and tucked into a neighborhood. If I return to Rome, it will be to Chambre d'Or

Reviews.Title: “Another treasure in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jdoggBelfastNIreland
Reviews.Content: Another treasure in the eternal city !!!! After reading so many bad reviews of hotel in Rome we were expecting nothing less than adequate accommodation. What we got was a lovely clean quiet hotel run by very pleasant and helpful staff with a good understanding of english. We were given a choice of smoking or non smoking, but unfortunately as a smoker in our mist required a smoking room we ended up with the smaller bathroom, not really a problem but the shower was soooo small, the only downside to our room.The hotel is situated two blocks from the Vatican and St Peters, a short walk for the metro station and has some beautiful shops. Restaurants are more expensive, especially just outside the Vatican walls and St Peters, so walk a few streets away and save a small fortune. Buy your water and drinks in small grocery stores for as little a 40 cents not 3 euros!! Good selection of restaurants at termmi station and are very reasonable, try the Road House Grill on the ground floor for lovely steaks at a very cheap price £15 euros all in, and the large self service restaurant on the upper floor. This is a good place to eat as you could be there at some point in the day while getting metro, bus or tours. Good tour is the open tram bus.For 12 euros see the city and it is stop and go. Get off where you want and pick up the bus again. If you get it early you can see most of the main sights and spend some time at them and get a good feel for the city. Lastly, bring very comfortable shoes as you will walk, walk,walk. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Home from home!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 and I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights in October, and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful, and all spoke good English - Sam was expecially helpful in finding us a great local restaurant - Dal Toscana. The room was very spacious and so was the bed! my son didn't want to sleep on his own in the small room which has a bed so he shared with my husaband and I there was more than enough room in the biggest doubel bed we have seen! The standard of housekeeping was more than adequate. We would definitely stay at the hotel again the next time we are in Rome.
